thread.title: Sanctuary city resolutions done, supervisors should revise law
thread.title_full: Sanctuary city resolutions done, supervisors should revise law - San Francisco Chronicle

author: San Francisco Chronicle
title: Sanctuary city resolutions done, supervisors should revise law
text:
Photo: Nathaniel Y. Downes, The Chronicle Members of the audience show their approval during supervisor Malia Cohen's remarks about San Francisco's current sanctuary policies at the regular meeting of the board at City Hall on Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015 in San Francisco, Calif. Members of the audience show their approval during supervisor Malia...
San Francisco supervisors unanimously embraced a nonbinding resolution Tuesday that supports the city’s existing sanctuary city policies and tabled a second that would have changed it. The resolutions allowed both sides to count political coup. Now they can take up the hard work of passing actual legislation to revise the law. Members of the audience show their approval during supervisor Malia Cohen's remarks about San Francisco's current sanctuary policies at the regular meeting of the board at City Hall on Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015 in San Francisco, Calif. San Francisco supervisors unanimously embraced a nonbinding resolution Tuesday that supports the city’s existing sanctuary city policies and tabled a second that would have changed it.
